alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Inland Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 8:06PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BEAUFORT, CHARLESTON AND COLLETON COUNTIES... At 806 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Green Pond, or 11 miles south of Walterboro, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Hollywood, Meggett, Hendersonville, Green Pond, Adams Run, Jacksonboro, Ashepoo, and Ritter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Inland Colleton
